numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The most prestigious colleges are prestigious because of the people that they admit.
2. Changing who these colleges admit will not give an advantage to people that these colleges formerly did not admit.
3. Changing who these colleges admit will make these colleges no longer prestigious.
4. It is plausible that Harvard graduates are desirable.
5. Harvard screens its applicants for desirability.
6. Harvard graduates are desirable because Harvard screens its applicants for desirability.
7. Harvard graduates are not desirable because of the education that they get at Harvard.
8. A similar fallacy exists for every highly selective school.
9. A highly selective school allows only the best students.
10. The meaning of best can vary.
11. If a school allows only the best students then the school does not have to be good.
12. If a school allows only the best students then the teachers of the school do not have to be good.
13. The best students will excel regardless of the school.
